title: Julien Baker and Torres Announce Joint U.S. Tour
description: In support of their new collaborative country album, Send a Prayer My Way, which arrives April 18
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: In support of their new collaborative country album, Send a Prayer My Way, which arrives April 18
text: Julien Baker and Torres are all-in on their new collaborative album Send a Prayer My Way, out April 18, and are eager to bring those country songs to life onstage together. The two artists have announced a U.S. tour for this spring, during which they will play material from the LP. Check out the full list of tour dates below.After kicking things off with a special set at Big Ears Festival in Knoxville, Tennessee at the end of March, Baker and Torres will make their way across the Midwest, South, and East Coast for this run. Along the way, the two will perform at a handful of other music festivals, too, including Kilby Block Party, Newport Folk Festival, and Green River Festival.Send a Prayer My Way is Baker and Torres’ first album written and performed together, but has been a shared idea between the two artists dating as far back as 2016. It’s led by the singles “Sugar in the Tank” (which the duo performed on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon) and “Sylvia.”Revisit the interviews “I’m Drowning but I’m OK: The Revelations of Torres’ Mackenzie Scott” and “Julien Baker on Being Queer, Southern, Christian, and Proud” on the Pitch.All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Julien Baker & Torres: Send a Prayer My Way TourJulien Baker & Torres:03-27-30 Knoxville, TN - Big Ears Festival04-03 Iowa City, IA - Mission Creek Festival04-23 Richmond, VA - The National04-24 Asheville, NC - The Orange Peel04-25 Saxapahaw, NC - Haw River Ballroom04-26 North Charleston, SC - High Water Music Festival04-28 Athens, GA - Georgia Theatre04-29 Oxford, MS - The Lyric Oxford04-30 Birmingham, AL - Iron City05-01 New Orleans, LA - Tipitina’s05-04 San Antonio, TX - Stable Hall05-05 Houston, TX - The Heights Theater05-06 Dallas, TX - Longhorn Ballroom05-07 Oklahoma City, OK - Tower Theatre05-09 Tulsa, OK - Cain’s Ballroom05-10 Lawrence, KS - Liberty Hall05-11 Minneapolis, MN - First Avenue05-12 Omaha, NE - The Admiral05-16 Salt Lake City, UT - Kilby Block Party06-20 Greenfield, MA - Green River Festival06-21 Highmount, NY - Mountain Jam07-04-05 Missoula, MT - Zootown Music Festival07-25-27 Newport, RI - Newport Folk Festival
html:
Julien Baker and Torres are all-in on their new collaborative album Send a Prayer My Way, out April 18, and are eager to bring those country songs to life onstage together. The two artists have announced a U.S. tour for this spring, during which they will play material from the LP. Check out the full list of tour dates below.

After kicking things off with a special set at Big Ears Festival in Knoxville, Tennessee at the end of March, Baker and Torres will make their way across the Midwest, South, and East Coast for this run. Along the way, the two will perform at a handful of other music festivals, too, including Kilby Block Party, Newport Folk Festival, and Green River Festival.

Send a Prayer My Way is Baker and Torres’ first album written and performed together, but has been a shared idea between the two artists dating as far back as 2016. It’s led by the singles “Sugar in the Tank” (which the duo performed on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon) and “Sylvia.”

Revisit the interviews “I’m Drowning but I’m OK: The Revelations of Torres’ Mackenzie Scott” and “Julien Baker on Being Queer, Southern, Christian, and Proud” on the Pitch.

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Julien Baker & Torres: Send a Prayer My Way Tour

Julien Baker & Torres:
